I am unashamed to admit that Autumn is one of my top four favourite seasons ğŸğŸ‚â˜€ï¸ ğŸ˜

Do you have a favourite season, or are you like me and just love all of them equally and the seasonal uniqueness they each bring?

Moody goodness - Tassie's west coast never disappoints! 
This Friday I'm showing one of my images at the @bobbrownfoundation Tarkine in Motion exhibition, which opens at 6pm at the Long Gallery, Salamanca Arts Centre, here in Hobart. 
Each year for the past three years over 100 artists have ventured into the Tarkine region of North West Tasmania to immerse themselves in the natural and cultural stories of the area. They come away inspired and energised and create art based on what they experienced. 
I participated in last years event and am thrilled to be exhibiting in one of Tasmania's premier art spaces. 
If you're in town, it is well worth checking out. Runs April 21 - May 1. 
This is Sarah Anne Rocks, one of my favourite places to escape the bustle of city life ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»

Light, in all its forms, is the friend of photographers; it's just a matter of perspective how you capture it. 
Yet a lone bird can be just as powerful in making an image, don't you think?

From my recent sunrise wanderings around kunanyi / Mt Wellington, as rays of early light created these magnificent beams across Hobart ğŸ’›

I'm curious...does a forest path like this ignite your imagination and draw you in to go exploring, or does it give you the shivers and make you want to run away?

There are dozens of trails like this on kunanyi / Mt Wellington, all waiting patiently for you to explore them ğŸ’š

This fleeting moment of golden goodness when the sun lined up through the fork in an old tree before disappearing behind the clouds was my favourite sight during a recent sunrise wander on the mountain. Hobart was glowing too as the sun warmed up the awakening city ğŸ’›ğŸ˜Š I hope you're having a lovely #Easter, too ğŸ’›

Whether you're an #Easter celebrator or not, I just hope you have a lovely weekend surrounded by people you cherish and can share a good laugh with â¤ğŸŒˆğŸ‡ğŸ¥šğŸ« I found this heavenly forest path in the foothills of kunanyi / Mt Wellington during my sunrise wandering recently. I really loved the white lichen that was like patchwork on the boulders. Soon there'll be snow right here, and I can't wait to see it transformed into a winter fairyland â„ï¸â›„ï¸

Craving some mountain time yesterday, I attempted to catch the sunrise from the top of kunanyi / Mt Wellington, but was foiled by thick clouds. Wandering along one of the trails on the lower slopes, I was chuffed to catch sight of this most splendid golden light warming the treetops ğŸ’› It was peaceful, tranquil and just what I was searching for - except for that incessant crow that wouldn't stop crowing ğŸ˜‚ Did you spot him/her?
